_comment: Improved JSON structure for better data organization and machine-readability.

history.summary: One of the original fighter units of the Luftstreitkräfte, Jasta 6 was a founding member of the 'Flying Circus'. The squadron was credited with 196 confirmed aerial victories and was known for its distinctive aircraft markings.

formation.context: Founded from Fokkerstaffel Sivry, an early fighter unit. Assigned to 2 Armee on 29 September 1916 and re-equipped with Albatros D.I fighters.

notableEvents.event: Moved to Markebecke to join Manfred von Richthofen's newly formed Jagdgeschwader I.
Began a difficult three-month period, losing a commanding officer each month to enemy action.
Disbanded at FEA 9, Darmstadt, shortly after the Armistice.

notablePilots.name: Franz Hemer
notablePilots.note: Notable ace who served in the squadron.

notablePilots.name: Kurt Küppers
notablePilots.note: Notable ace who served in the squadron.

markings.description: Aircraft often had black and white stripes on their elevators. Later Fokker Dr.I triplanes featured an engine cowling painted in a scarlet and white petal pattern.

source.comment: Original source path was an absolute path, changed to a relative one for portability.
